Dalhousie Lake Loons “Gettin’ Busy” on a Platform: Ontario Lakes Project

12 Feb 2013

Of course, that the call of loons in fundamental to the Ontario lake experience. Their haunting calls are the perfect soundtrack to a relaxing evening at the cottage. Even though they are the symbol of utter relaxation, it turns out these birds are quite stressed. This is not good news. Loons’ nests are easily impacted by rising water levels, power boats and shoreline development. This has the Dalhousie Lake dwellers taking a DIY approach to providing them refuge.

A volunteer member of the Dalhousie Lake Association has shared information on building a DIY Loon Nesting Platform to be an inviting and safe habitat for loon populations. Turns out, all you need are cedar log, vinyl-coated chain-link fence, two anchors or cinder blocks and stuff for the nest–like straw, bulrushes, long grasses, etc.

In this NSFW video, two loons demonstrate just how comfy the platform can be by “gettin’ it on” (albiet briefly) on an artificial platform. Even the loons know how to keep the love life fresh.
